reviews.review: The game has a very unique art style and the community is nice and friendly, there has been a bot crisis but im sure that will be fixed. Thank you valve #savetf2
G√ºzel g√ºzeldi valve oyunu burakana kadar
the bots are too entrentched into the game. there is no saving it now and its a damn shame.
as a big fan of playing pyro, i have been informed by my friends that everyone else hates me

The fact that this game has been active since its release in 2007, shows how devoted players are to this game, with custom maps, weapons, and game modes, its no wonder this game has lasted for so long. I just really hate for this game to just wither away because of valves neglect to the game even though, like i said, still has a very large community. Its one thing if the community has dwindled away or they just keep making new games (which they don't). So they really don't have an excuse other than being lazy. I truly hope valve hears our pleas to remove these bots from the servers and return Team Fortress 2 back to it's former glory.

#saveTF2

Amo este juego, pero no se lo recomiendo a nadie que no tenga experiencia jugandolo ya. incluso ignorando las promesas de contenido incumplidas (Heavy Update) el juego esta en una condicion deplorable. bots infestan las partidas, arruinando por completo la experiencia hasta que logren ser kickeados e incluso servers enteros pueden llegar a ser completamente conquistados por ellos.
Y Valve, genios que son, deciden mutear a las cuentas Free 2 Play, o sea si eres nuevo no puedes comunicarte con tu equipo, en el maldito EQUIPO FORTALEZA SEGUNDO alguien nuevo que seguro tenga preguntas de como jugar esta completamente solo en un juego que de por si es bastante complejo
Y porque, despues de todo lo que he dicho aun lo sigo jugando? es porque es uno de los mejores juegos que he jugado en mi vida, y con mucho dolor no recomiendo que lo jueges

P.d: debido a lo que la comunidad hizo el 26 de mayo (un berrinche multiplataforma coordinado con miles de posts en varias redes sociales y un boludo que fue a las oficinas de Valve) lograron sacarle un tweet a la cuenta oficial de TF2. si por algun milagro una update solucionara el problema de los bots y el bullying a los F2P (que al principio era para solucionar los bots, medida que fracaso duro) genuinamente ignoraria toda cosa mala que ha hecho Valve y daria una review positiva
Full of cheaters and bots, fix this shit and then Ill play it again, community ruined a perfectly good game. It's not worth playing now at all

I'd say bury it down. Let's keep it as gmod content.
Wanna have best possible experience? Play TF2Classic.
classic. really need valve to address bot problem tho. voting no just for visibility to the issue, otherwise its a great game that still holds up today

I've put 2000+ hours into this game, PLEASE SAVE TF2!

I really hope for the bright future for one of my favorite games

#SaveTF2
It wouldnt be so bad and full off bots, if Valve would give this beautiful game updates
i just wanna play the game please

I have played this game since it first came out with roughly 2000 hours between two accounts. I still enjoy this game. Myself and others are still finding new strategies, tech/mechanics, and memes that keep bringing us back. You can play this game pretty much any way you like, as a beer and pretzel game or trying your heart out, modded servers and competitive modes/leagues, you won't find yourself questioning why you still play like other games. This game came out good and has been improved and polished with years of content. But strangely enough, it still has plenty of things to improve/tweak. And of course it's been free for a while, and you can drop and pick this game back up whenever you like without worrying that something you enjoyed is now gone. 10/10.

=================================

I would like to say as of (5/26/22 #savetf2) It must be said that tf2 could do with a fix for the bot problem, Myself and I assume many other long time players simply moved to community servers to just not deal with the problem (I must say I have even enjoyed it more than normal pubs anyways), I am worried that new players will not have as much fun when dealing with the man vs machine mode that is 33.333% continuing of course, pubs.

I would recommend to new players to use community servers for the time being, my personal favorite atm to be the "uncletopia" servers as they are pretty much just better pubs. Honestly you will still probably have fun in pubs anyways.

Although I assume that no soul will even see this (especially anybody from valve) I would like to say that I don't want any more cheap, lazy, carbon copy cosmetics and the complete utter silence from valve. I want players to be able to play in valve servers, I want to be able to do the contracts I paid a ticket for, and I want people to have as much fun as iv had playing this game. Thank you valve for the years of game play, but "plz fix".
#savetf2 COME ON VALVE GET OVER YOURSELVES AND GET RID OF THE BOTS

#savetf2

i have not been able to touch this game for years. the bots make it unplayable. i really did enjoy this game before such a thing took it over. valve, can you please fix this someway, somehow? there has to be something, right?
EDIT: it seems someone has responded to the save tf2! i hope something actually can be done...

Game is practically unplayable due to bots. Decided to launch the game again after a couple of years, and the first match I‚Äôve joined had bots. Finding a casual match with no bots is almost a miracle, and playing on community servers is not the solution.

I just hope that Valve does something, anything, to fix this issue. Even acknowledging the problem would be something. Until then, I can‚Äôt enjoy this game anymore.
El quinto mejor juego que he jugado en mi vida. 9/10

Love the characters, story, gameplay, and community. 

Please remove the bots from your own servers, Valve.
The game has been alive for more than 15 years, and these past years it's been more alive than ever.
In the store page description it says "The most highly-rated free game of all time!", but since Jungle inferno it has become the most neglected active game of all time.

Your lack of communication and ignorance is saddening, Valve.
Don't let the bots kill this legendary game
This game has been on life support for years, and Valve still refuses to do anything about the bot crisis. Please let this game die, while it still makes money Valve is just gonna keep milking it.

Came back to try it again after years, has aged incredibly poorly with the microtransactoin loadouts, has no developer support and every match I got put in was filled with bots and people complaining about bots.

Team Fortress is the grandfather of class-based shooters for a reason. The classes are all unique, dynamic, and fun. At first you will fall in love with the witty zaniness of the charm and style, then later you will find the refined game feel and depth the game offers. The lack of hidden MMR may make casual games unbalanced, but I love it, it's a game you will get absolutely wrecked at first but you will feel yourself improve as you become the one dominating new players. Fun for casual players, midcore players, and hardcore players all at the same time. It feels like I'm robbing Valve for having thousands of hours of fun on a free game.

No game is perfect, the official competitive matchmaking is dead, random crits are annoying, the tutorial is nonfunctional, and the default settings are garbage. If you are new, look up good settings and how to play online, this will drastically improve your experience. 

I said I would change my review to positive if the bots and ddossing were fixed, and they were, official servers are playable finally. Before #SaveTF2 the servers were filled with cheaters and bots, now they are not.

Game is in maintainence mode, it likely won't receive new official content or balance updates, but there's a lot of content here already to enjoy and the game is still getting bug fixes and community made content added.
